attributes.action: Create more apprenticeships in policing and security.
attributes.background: After trying everything i have found there are minimal opportunities to get an apprenticeship in that professional area due to regulation on overtime and budget cuts more apprenticeships should be created in the security and policing areas to give people the experience required.
attributes.additional_details: I have been told the police no longer offer work experience by members of their staff and the security industry do not seem to provide apprenticeships, i see this as wrong because at a job interview all they will want is experience and without an apprenticeship you do not have that and they will dismiss you and hire an experienced Candidate.

attributes.action: Enabled Payment for School Dinners with Child Care Vouchers
attributes.background: For a family with 2 children, school dinners cost in the region of £900 per year. With family costs rising rapidly and well ahead of wages, this is becoming increasingly unaffordable for many parents.
attributes.additional_details:
More than one in five children at some primary schools in England start their first and final years of primary school underweight, figures show.

Allowing school meals to be paid for with childcare vouchers would ease family costs and increase take-up rate.

Hence, we hereby petition the Government to make it possible to pay for School Dinners via the Child Care Vouchers scheme.

attributes.action: Pay parity to all recipients of a British retirement Pension.
attributes.background: Unfair treatment to some recipients, in largely Commonwealth countries, where pensions are frozen in some countries, but not others. A classic example is Canada frozen, America not frozen.

attributes.action: Race or Jump, not Both! Stop Equine Steeplechases
attributes.background: This petition has been created in light of the recent horse fatalities at Cheltenham and Aintree 2016. Equine steeplechases with high hurdles over long distances have significantly higher morbidity and mortality rates than flat races and should therefore be stopped

attributes.action: Only British Born Citizens can have: Health Care - Benefits / Housing / Voting
attributes.background: Only British Born Citizens have rights to: Government owned or sponsored Health Care & Housing / Benefits / Voting. Citizens living in the country 20 or more years can have the same rights if they already have British citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Just trying to save UK from outside influences usually only British born citizens and long standing citizens really care about the country and there fellow neighbors.

attributes.action: Scrap cash benefits and bring in 'Welfare Vouchers' that are monetary value.
attributes.background: Introduce a welfare voucher for individuals, couples and families alike which will replace the benefits that they are on. No one will be out of pocket as they will get exactly the same amount of monetary value, based on their circumstances
attributes.additional_details: The government could work in partnership with all the major retailers like ASDA, Sainsbury’s, Morrison’s, Tesco etc. Supermarkets can claim the money back from their local authority, it will be similar to the healthy start vouchers, but on a bigger scale.  Help stop wasting tax payers money, by people spending our tax money on scratchcards alcohol and cigarettes. Buying stuff they actually need. The welfare voucher will restrict by not being able to buy scratchcards with them and limit how much cigarettes and alcohol they can buy with them as well.

attributes.action: Make the size of motorcyle you are able to get at the age of 19-20 be a 600 cc
attributes.background: it is the threshold of not being too powerful for riders that have been riding for 2 years and allows them to get used to a slightly more powerful bike before they upgrade to an unlimited liscence this will allow bikers to gain vital experience if they feel they are ready to get a larger cc later on
attributes.additional_details:
You are more likly to have a crash on a motorcyle however it should be the riders choice to ride a larger or smaller bike.
This link shows that the rate of deaths caused by motorcycles was falling by 9% in 2012 before the new age restricted Euro laws were applied. And a large number of bike crashes were caused by car drivers not paying attention to them
http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/2015/march/new-accident-stats-show-large-decrease
These are the most up to date statistics

attributes.action: Bring back the death sentence for proven murder and rape cases
attributes.background: A lot of people are convicted of murder and rape in the UK, and we are suppose to bring justice to those people, but instead they are imprisoned (and usually even get out eventually!) and tax payers and the government pay for their food, drinks, shelter. We shouldn't waste money on keeping them here
attributes.additional_details: The government needs to think how much money they spend on keeping evil monsters alive, the number will be high! The supporters of this petition believe that people who are convicted of rape and murder to be able to receive death sentences from the court. If justice is served, the number of cases of such crimes may even go down. However, of course 100% evidence must be given before handing out such a sentence.

attributes.action: force absent parents to see their children
attributes.background: absent parents put their needs first before their children,force the absent parent to see their children after all children are a lifetime commitment for both parents.children need a relationship with mum and dad through out their childhood.

attributes.action: Require Royal Mint to 'buy back' Legal Tender coinage it has issued
attributes.background: Apparently the Royal Mint has recently instructed banks not to buy back commemorative coinage such as the 2015 Buckingham Palace £100 silver coin that it issued as Legal Tender thus forcing holders of said coins to the open market
attributes.additional_details: Legal Tender - the majority of people take the phrase 'Legal Tender'  to mean that when this is applied to coinage it will be acceptable at a Bank

attributes.action: Increase benefits for people who receive "Contribution based Benefits
attributes.background: . I was appalled when I contacted DWP for help and was informed that the Bereavement Benefit I was in receipt of, was higher than what the Government say I can live on
attributes.additional_details:
As my husband  was of Pensionable age the under occupancy did not apply when he was alive???? However since his death DWP removed all my husbands benefits (I have worked for over 40 years) how could this be... They will only pay contribution JSA for 6 months (which was stopped shortly after my husband passed away. 
Therefore I was informed that I can apply for Bereavement Benefit of £112 per week. 
Out of the £112 I was expected to pay full rent £97.79 per week and C.Tax.
I finally received a letter confirming that I would be exempt from the Underoccupancy due to the sudden death of my husband. It will only apply for 12 months where after I am expected to pay for the Underoccupancy,  this is DISCRIMINATION towards age.

attributes.action: Scrap the DVLA restriction to assign any age number plate to any age car
attributes.background:
This means that people can apply a personalised registration plate on any age car regardless of the age of plate 
Making it easier for DVLA to sell number plates and making them more valuable as they are more applicable.
attributes.additional_details:
Scrap the dated restriction preventing the application of newer style number plates to old cars 
Information on a cars actual year of release is widely available in the modern times apps HPI checks etc and this would become buyer responsibility similar to checking if a car is stolen or written off when buying. 
Making it harder to get caught out e.g 2006 plate on a 2004 car would HPI check as 2004 car.
This would mean less paperwork for DVLA and more revenue from personalised registrations

attributes.action: ASPA'86 revised to ban use of animal testing and selling of tested goods in UK.
attributes.background: Since 1882 the use of animal testing has been reduced. But when the media states a reduction, it compares from the horrific state of which we treated animals to a position where we were only capable of improvement. In this age, 2016, is it still acceptable for this inhumane act to continue?
attributes.additional_details:
Most figures displayed by the media do not include animals that are bred for the purpose of testing and for use of tissue
then discarded or rejected because their genetic modifications did not work.
Use of animals:
Rodents 84%
Fish, amphibians, reptiles 12%
Large mammals 2.1%
Small mammals 1.4%
Dogs and cats 0.3%
Primates 0.1%
Scientists suggest that new drugs in development that act in very specific ways in the body may lead to more animals (specifically primates) being used in future years.

attributes.action: Urge North Korea to pardon Otto Warmbier and free him from his 15 year sentence.
attributes.background: A 21 year old US student has been sentenced to 15 years hard labour for removing a political poster. This is a very harsh punishment for a small crime - the sentence may be politically motivated towards the US as tensions are high between the two countries.

attributes.action: Abolish SEN statements on diagnosis of ASD. Those without one, are being failed.
attributes.background: My stepson, like many other children, has Asperger's. But, because he is intelligent and appears to cope with school, he can't get an educational statement of needs (SEN), resulting in him failing at school. Those without a SEN are being failed. I want to bring change to give him what he needs.
attributes.additional_details: Severe stress, anxiety and lack of support, from any part of the system, has left him facing his GCSE year with 43% attendance, inability to do moc's or exams and grades dropped from A's & C,s to U. We've had to resort to a Child Psychologist, consultant and our MP, Theresa May, to get the desperately required action to manage the associated issues. He's been failed by 'the system' and facing a bleak future without the needed help. Abolishing SEN will change his life and thousands like him.

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords todiscriminate against families with children.
attributes.background: Landlords should not be able to refuse to rent their propert to people based on whether they have children or not unless there is a safety issue. Many do not refuse on this basis and even stipulate criteria like 'one child only.' This practice should not be allowed to continue.

attributes.action: Seek a UN treaty on mutual recognition and enforcement of telephone privacy laws
attributes.background: Despite using the TPS, I have been bombarded with spam telephone calls from India and some other foreign countries. Many of these calls are barely disguised scams. Within the EU there is mutual recognition of such schemes and it works well. This should be extended by treaty to all nations in the ITU
attributes.additional_details:
TPS = Telephone Preference Service
ITU = International Telecommunications Union, a UN agency

To understand what gave me this idea, see: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-creepiest-phone-call-or-voice-message-youve-ever-received/answer/Peter-Charlot and my (Charles Stuart) comment.

Ofcom recognizes that people outside the EU are beyond their control. I would like a treaty to address this and set up mandatory reciprocal recognition of cold calling laws among ITU member states.

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis users to grow upto 5 plants without fear of prosecution
attributes.background: We are here to ask for the law to allow us users the ability to grow up to FIVE plants for personal use across the UK (Durham have already done this, as well as almost ALL of the USA with states by-passing the DEA to allow users access Washington State recently) from seed without taking cuttings!

attributes.action: Restrict drivers aged 17-22 to cars limited to 40mph and 0-60mph 15 secs
attributes.background: It is common to see young drivers driving badly, too fast, aggressively,  and involved in accidents that cause death and injury to themselves and others. I believe it would be a relatively easy step to restrict the power and speed of cars driven by young drivers.
attributes.additional_details: It would require car manufacturers to create a new range of restricted, but affordable cars, that would also lead to cheaper insurance for first time drivers.

attributes.action: Legal limit for clearance of the accidents and road re opening under 2 hours.
attributes.background:
23/08/2016 M27 closed FOR 6 HOURS! at Junction Two for Salisbury after caravan overturns on A31 near Cadnam. 
Excessive amount of work, Excessive shut down, Dangerous situation for public and the Nature on Diverted routs.
attributes.additional_details:
Road maintenance looks increasingly like a gravy train! Inefficiency is really spectacular ! They obviously sacrificed efficiency to illusion of safety. The question, how many accidents has happened on diverted routs? How many social and economic consequences from that careless inaction? How bad an congestion impact on nature? 
And it is everywhere, not only accidents. Why to limit 20 Ml of M3 from Heathrow to Fleet? We hear lots of words about infrastructure so far, but no action!

attributes.action: Offer teachers salary sacrifice car scheme
attributes.background: Sources continue to raise awareness of the teacher shortage crisis. Even though there are initiatives to recruit new teachers, more needs to be done to retain the best teachers by offering incentives such as a car salary sacrifice schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationopinion/12182027/How-to-solve-the-teacher-recruitment-crisis.html

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/jul/26/secondary-schools-spent-56m-teacher-job-ads-labour

http://www.fleetnews.co.uk/news/fleet-industry-news/2015/06/01/government-to-consider-salary-sacrifice-car-schemes-for-teachers

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Lower the 20% and bring back the 17.5% rate of VAT
attributes.background: Years ago the government raised VAT to 20 percent from 17.5 percent, when Great Britain ran out of money and the recession was looming. Years on, the Government has said time and time again we are out of a recession and jobs are at a record high. It's time to give families back their extra money.

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap November 2016.
attributes.background: the benefit cap is not being publicised it Will affect thousands of families and children and will leave people 50 pound worse off or more a week it will come directly from your housing benefit and leave people to make up the short fall.This will leave people homeless or not able to pay bills
attributes.additional_details: Please google benefit cap calculator and select November 2016 to see if you are affected

attributes.action: Make it law to give bespoke acknowledgment & feedback to every job application
attributes.background: When applying for jobs, directly or via an agency, there's often no acknowledgment of application. If turned down, there's often no feedback. It's therefore not transparent & gives no chance to improve. We'd like a law to make employers acknowledge receipt & give short, bespoke feedback when asked.
attributes.additional_details:
Anecdotally, only 1 in 5 employers & agencies give acknowledgment of receipt. Of this, almost all give basic, generic reasons why you weren't interviewed. 
From interviews, only 1 in 2 potential employers give bespoke feedback. This means for every job applied for, you'll only get a clear reason you weren't considered for the role in around 1 in 40 occasions. 
How are you supposed to improve? We'd like a law to make employers give bespoke feedback of at least 100 words given when asked.

attributes.action: Stop cutting child benefits for families struggling in the uk
attributes.background: From April 2016 the income threshold was cut from £6,420 to £3,850 meaning fewer people are eligible to claim child benefits, for families with over two children in the UK this means that they will not get benefits for the 3rd+ child.

attributes.action: home buyer's consumer rights must be protected better with tighter regulations.
attributes.background: The rights of the home buyer must be protected with more stringent regulations.  Consumer rights for home buyers must be implemented and enforced. Legislation must force builders to resolve items (floor area, design etc) prior to sale. stronger regulation must be enforced for after sale responses.
attributes.additional_details: I purchased a new build on help-to-buy from a reputable builder who benefitted (£600 million in bonuses alone) by miss-selling their houses. The floor space of the house is 6.5% less than advertised. The losses are significant based on the correlation of area to price.The NHBC guarantee provided for new homes must protect interests of the home buyer from the builders. This is a failing system. The advertised floor area and design must be proven before the sale with the right to cancellation.

attributes.action: To ban balloon releases to protect environment and wildlife
attributes.background: Mass balloon releases are causing a devastating impact on both the environment and wildlife on land and sea, there are many other ways to pay tribute to our loved ones without endangering our own wildlife and environments for example candlelight vigils, carol evenings, photo rememberances etc.
attributes.additional_details: Search YouTube, Google etc and see the devastating impact balloon releases have.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling, automated message calling, and cold texting or emailing
attributes.background: We are all tired of answering the 'phone and it is a cold caller you didn't want to hear from or didn't request, or it's an automated message telling us about the latest government initiative for windows or whatever.  Add the calls or emails or texts about an accident that you may/may not have had.
attributes.additional_details: I am a personal injury, clinical negligence and professional negligence solicitor and I am fed up with people wanting to "help" me when really I'm just another number to try and make money from.

attributes.action: I want Parliament to fund the RNLI, Coastguard Helicopters and Air Ambulances
attributes.background: The RNLI, Coastguard Helicopters and Air Ambulances are a vital part of our emergency services and should not solely rely on charity funding to operate, they should be funded just as the Police, Fire and ambulance services are funded

attributes.action: Put The Open Golf Championship back on free to air TV
attributes.background: This is the first time in 60 years The Open as not been broadcast on free to air TV. Signing the petition will help influence the government to make The Open Championship a group A protected listed sporting event. Live coverage of the event will then be offered to free to air broadcasters.
attributes.additional_details: The Open Championship dates back to 1860 and is the the world's most prestigious golf tournament and one of four golf majors. With the an international field of the world's best golfers competing for the top prize in golf. The coverage of The Open as been enjoyed by millions on the BBC for the last 60 years, inspiring viewers of all ages to go out and play golf. As a nation we should be proud to host this event and it should be celebrated as one of the great British sporting events.

attributes.action: Protect the original terms of students loans in statutory law
attributes.background: Students plan their financial future according to the terms of student loans.  The fragility of these terms was exposed by the recent freeze of the repayment threshold.  Prevent current and future governments betraying the trust of students with statutory protection of student loan terms.
attributes.additional_details: Student loans as of 2011/12 were based on a number of terms, including 9% rate of pay back over earning threshold of £21k, write-off of debt after 30 years. None of these terms are safeguarded in law meaning government can retrospectively change the terms of the loan, as evidenced to the recent freeze of earning threshold (see Alex True's petition). Imagine what an increase in the pay back rate would mean for your or your child's future. Google Sutton Trust's "Unfair deal" report.

attributes.action: Change policy "reducing drugs & misuse & dependence" for Fibromyalgia sufferers.
attributes.background:
it is trying to reduce the misuse of prescription drugs.
However , due to the stigma associated with Fibromyalgia & M.E, by some in the medical profession and the fact we are living with an invisible illness I feel many people living with Fibro & M.E are wrongly assumed to be misusing medication.
attributes.additional_details: I have gone from working hard all my life and never taking from the system to a person in agony most days, I need help with dressing, can't cook, can't drive, as a consequence of the pain all over my body I have become very depressed and fear for my future. I am no longer able to work and I am about to go on zero wages and will have to retire due to being too ill. I am 47. The only thing that helps me is my  medication which has taken 6 months to get right, but I now have to beg for weekly.

attributes.action: Invest more funds into research, management & recovery of CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue
attributes.background: After being diagnosed with CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue Syndrome in 2013, I've struggled to get any ongoing support for my symptoms, management and recovery. There's simply not enough understood about the condition within the NHS or the general public. More research and media exposion is urgently needed!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.meassociation.org.uk

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/how-you-can-help/introduction-to-our-cbt-get-and-pacing-report/

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/research2015/cfsme-research-collaborative/

https://www.actionforme.org.uk

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/ifp/chapter/Managing-CFSME

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/evidence/full-guideline-196524109

attributes.action: Always send users of Class A substances such as heroin to rehab, not jail
attributes.background: Due to the horrific nature of addiction when it comes to substances such as Heroin and Crack cocaine I believe we should be giving users as much help as possible. These people need treatment, not punishment. Making it harder for them to get a job is also less likely to get them off these substances.

attributes.action: Limit government special advisor severance pay to the minimum contract amount
attributes.background: Former Prime Minister David Cameron has overruled civil service advice so his special advisers get severance pay worth £282,000. This is contractually unnecessary and morally wrong at a time of public spending austerity. It smacks of cronyism and the money would be better spent on essential services

attributes.action: Don't Trigger Article 50 until at least after next US President takes office
attributes.background:
In deciding when UK should trigger Article 50, UK citizens demand that Government wait until next President of America has been elected & takes office. Triggering Article 50 should not be before 21 January 2017 
Future US Presidency could become protectionist. Benefits of Brexit could be tenuous
attributes.additional_details:
UK citizens are being told that exiting EU offers opportunity for UK to benefit from trade with other countries outside the EU.
However those in favour of Brexit fail to identify very real prospect that American could become very protectionist.
In assessing benefits of Brexit against real negatives of Brexit, UK government can only but proceed with extreme caution & wait until the election of next President of America & takes office to know for certain future benefits of Brexit.

attributes.action: Reverse the agreement for the MOD to purchse helicopters from the USA
attributes.background: The UK helicopter manufacturers have a fantastic track record and in the present economic uncertainty of the UK it would be wrong to award the new fleet to US manufacturers.  The UK has proved over many many years that they could fulfil the MODs requirements.

attributes.action: Terrorism: victim family members to be invited on independent commission.
attributes.background: When acts of terrorism occur, victim family members should be given the opportunity to be part of an independent commission (funded by the UK government), to ensure there is a full & proper investigation into the death of their loved ones.

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs overtaking restrict to inside lane only motorways dual carriageways
attributes.background: Lorries that overtake can sometimes take 2-5 miles to do so and should all be restricted to roughly the same maximum speed, I Believe that all HGVs should be banned from overtaking and be restricted to use if the inside lane only (except if Turing right dual carriageways )
attributes.additional_details: I'm sure we have all spent miles behind a lorry creeping past another whilst blocking a huge queue of cars and vehicles who are clearly faster moving only for the lorry to after an age pull back in front of the other lorry it's absolutely pointless and dangerous and costs money in water time for others and builds anger and frustration in all concerned

attributes.action: Get NHS backing for MAP vaccine for Crohn's disease and colitis cure
attributes.background: I am a Crohn's disease and colitis sufferer. Life is very difficult because there is no cure. There is a possible cure at the Kings college hospital. The trials cannot go ahead because there is not enough funding. Meanwhile IBD sufferers have to struggle with life. This vaccine could help cure IBD
attributes.additional_details: There are 250,000 people in the UK that suffer from IBD, over 80% need to have surgery to correct or remove the colon. It is a chronic disease which is debilitating. Prof. John. Hermon - Taylor has worked out that a bacteria found in cattle is transferred to humans with a weak immune system. I have to have lots of medication to get through each day and have been hospitalised because I cannot get a remission. Crohn's and colitis sufferers are desperate for a cure. The vaccine is ready to test

attributes.action: Pursue a tariff free trade deal and free movement of people deal with the USA
attributes.background: We have been allies for a long time and we would highly complement each other to be able to trade and move freely for purposes of work and or family reuniting purposes, students should still be under student visas however!
attributes.additional_details: My own example is my wife and I married over in the USA 15/04/2011 due to unrealistic income requirement have been apart for 5 years of our marriage we have had just 9 months together 3 in USA and 6 in the UK, she has vast experience in care and in hotel management and retail so could get a job here, I am easily able to gain work there as a PSV driver and HGV and or in gaining EMT state certification there to gain employment! Both of us would have to file taxes in our own countries even if zero!

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to £50,000 in debt.

attributes.action: Call a General Election once the new Conservative leader has been selected.
attributes.background: The EU referendum result has left the current government with no backup plan. This petition therefore asks for a General Election to be called so that the parties can set out their positions with regard to EU negotiations. The new government can then go forward with a new mandate and clear plans.
attributes.additional_details: For better or worse, if the UK leaves the EU, we will be entering an unfamiliar economic and diplomatic landscape. A General Election would give the nation an opportunity to debate the implications of the vote and our place in the world. It may not be legally required but, given the vast implications of the referendum result, a General Election is surely a moral and democratic necessity. The future direction of the whole country should not be decided by the members of any single political party.

attributes.action: Make vet check-ups and treatments free.
attributes.background: Many poor families have pets, and if that pet gets into a fight, they might not have the money to pay for treatment.

attributes.action: Lets Join The Nordic Alliance. Post Brexit
attributes.background: Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.
attributes.additional_details:
Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.

"When Britain leaves the EU, we will see a triangle that covers a large part of the globe: Greenland, Iceland, the Faroe Islands, Norway - and now the United Kingdom,” said Iceland’s President Olafur Ragnar Grimsson

attributes.action: Set the voting age for referendums to 16
attributes.background:
Referendums cover issues with a long term effect. 

Very often a 16 year old at voting time will be 18 when the decision comes into force
attributes.additional_details:
In Scotland the voting age for many elections is already 16.

It is not logical to deprive these people of the vote for referendums.

A next step should be to make the voting age for referendums 16 throughout the UK

attributes.action: Add an option for "Protest / No Confidence" to all ballot voting options.
attributes.background: Rather than depending on spoiled ballot papers to count protest votes, introduce an official way for the voting public to express their democratic right to show that they have a political opinion, but they disagree with all the views of a campaign or political parties.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large number of the voting public who feel disenfranchised by our political parties and representatives, who feel like they have no representive or political voice. Spoiled ballot papers are not always clearly counted, and in the case of a referendum can be ignored completely. Having a specific option that allows the voting public to voice their desire to be involved, but that they are excluded from the current political parties, leaders or campaigns is essential for democracy.
